articles.author: Deisy Buitrago, Mayela Armas
articles.description: Protests by ruling party and opposition supporters are expected to take place in Venezuela on Tuesday in the wake of a disputed election victory by President Nicolas Maduro, with the opposition saying vote tallies show its candidate easily won.
articles.title: Venezuela ruling party, opposition rally supporters in election dispute

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An Israeli strike targeted a senior Hezbollah commander in Beirut's southern suburbs at dusk on Tuesday, a senior Lebanese security source said, adding that the commander's fate remained unclear.
articles.title: Israeli strike on Beirut targets senior Hezbollah commander, source says

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Mohammad Salem
articles.description: Thousands of Palestinians returned to their homes in the ruins of Gaza's main southern city Khan Younis on Tuesday, after Israeli forces ended a week-long incursion there which they said aimed to prevent Islamist armed group Hamas from regrouping.
articles.title: Israeli forces quit east Khan Younis, Palestinians recover dozens of bodies

articles.author: Chris Thomas, Munsif Vengattil, Jose Devasia
articles.description: At least 23 people were killed and scores injured after landslides in the hills of India's southern Kerala state, authorities said, with rescue operations were hampered after a main bridge collapsed in the region.
articles.title: Kerala's Wayanad landslide: At least 23 dead, more rain predicted

articles.author: Phil Stewart, Idrees Ali
articles.description: The Army has stopped paying wages and allowances to a U.S. soldier sentenced last month to nearly four years in a Russian penal colony and may prosecute him if he returns to the United States, U.S. officials said.
articles.title: Exclusive: US Army stops paying soldier imprisoned in Russia, may prosecute him

articles.author: Guy Faulconbridge, Lidia Kelly
articles.description: Russia's navy began planned exercises involving most of its fleet in the Arctic and Pacific oceans as well and the Baltic and Caspian seas, the defence ministry said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Russian navy starts major drills involving most of its fleet

articles.author: Hatem Khaled
articles.description: Israel's military blew up more than 30 water wells in Gaza this month, a municipality official and residents said, adding to the trauma of air strikes that have turned much of the Palestinian enclave into a wasteland ravaged by a humanitarian crisis.
articles.title: Destruction of Gaza water wells deepens Palestinian misery

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. Deputy Secretary of State Kurt Campbell said on Tuesday that he expects word soon that India is becoming more engaged with Ukraine, responding to a question at a Senate hearing over Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to Moscow this month.
articles.title: Top US diplomat expects more Indian engagement with Ukraine

articles.author: Allende Miglietta, David Morgan, Sarah N. Lynch
articles.description: The U.S. Secret Service's new acting director said in prepared congressional testimony on Tuesday he was "ashamed" of a major security lapse that preceded the July 13 attempted assassination of Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump at a Pennsylvania campaign rally.
articles.title: US Secret Service acting director 'ashamed' about Trump shooting

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Peruvian prime minister, Gustavo Adrianzen, said on Tuesday that the prosecutor's office has "definitively" shelved genocide case against president Dina Boluarte.
articles.title: Peruvian prosecutor shelves genocide case against president Dina Boluarte
